subject: Quikscript Publishing Workflow (was: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Qs-classics, now with a codebase)
msgSnippet: ... I m still more than willing to help keep the different source versions (my Markdown version of Call of Cthulhu, say) of Quikscript literature in sync, but
messageBody:
On May 14, 2013, at 9:57 PM, Timothy <tim_rice09@...> wrote:

The work is done, and now there is a centralized place to share and improve works of literature in QS.

https://sourceforge.net/p/qs-classics/code/

I would be overjoyed to add more developers to the project.

I'm still more than willing to help keep the different source versions (my Markdown version of Call of Cthulhu, say) of Quikscript literature in sync, but I'm not sure that one-line Subversion commits to https://sourceforge.net/p/qs-classics/code/ will help if they'll be written by the next file set to come out of AdaptIt.

It seems like the workflow with the least amount of potentially repeated work would be:

  1. Somebody picks a work — probably from Project Gutenberg. Probably not me, either. Let's call it foo.txt.
  2. I get a copy of said work in Orthodox, in 7-bit-ASCII.
  3. I reformat said work in Markdown — convert "a--b" to "a — b", curl quotes, etc. Let's call it foo.orthodox.markdown.
  4. I send beautified Orthodox work to Tim Rice, whose AdaptIt workflow is much better than mine.
  5. Tim Rice posts foo.markdown somewhere.
  6. I copy foo.markdown into my GitHub repo verbatim
  7. I run `make clean && make` to generate the HTML and ePub files
  8. I add the new HTML and ePub files to the repo, and then push to GitHub.

One problem that I had with AdaptIt is that I couldn't get it to leave my linebreaks alone. If I feed a nicely-formatted Markdown document into AdaptIt, the output had pretty much all of its vertical whitespace yanked out (makes sense for USFM, but not for anything else). This becomes a problem when AdaptIt output gets fed into a Markdown processor — as it stands in Call-of-Cthulhu-QS.txt, part 1, will be rendered as one paragraph.

If AdaptIt can't be made to leave vertical whitespace alone, then any Orthodox change I report will either require:

  • updating foo.orthodox.markdown
  • [manually] updating foo.markdown
or
  • updating foo.orthodox.markdown
  • [manually] turning foo.adaptit-output.txt into adaptit-output.markdown (an irritation only partially automatable with s/\n/\n\n/g)

At least on my end, the former set of steps is much easier.

Anything I can do on my end to eliminate intermediate manual steps?
